answers.answer: Hi, understand your predicament. According to studies done, multiple shocks and ICD storm are a relatively common event among patients with ICDs (10-20%). Successful management of patients post shock includes the use of antiarrhythmic medications and careful attention to the causality of the shocks via stored electrograms. The psychological management includes specific attention to debriefing post-shock feelings and attributions, preventing avoidance behavior, and facilitating positive "return to life" actions. Please discuss this with your doctor am sure he will provide further assistance. Regards.

question: I have an AICD.  I have 3 stents, severe Arrhythmias. I also have type 2 diabetes and severe fibromyalgia.I'm on my 2nd AICD and recently it has started shocking me a lot.  The other day it fired 4 times within just a few minutes.  It is set to fire when my heart rate exceeds 238.I wind up in the hospital, and it doesn't go off again and after all their tests, etc I'm released again.So.. what can I do to help my body stay out of the zone for the shocks.,
title: AICD keeps shocking me.
